The contact owns a 2019 Chevrolet Silverado 1500.  The contact stated that while driving approximately 30 MPH, the warning message "low oil turn off vehicle" had displayed. The vehicle was parked and upon inspection it was discovered that no engine oil was present on the engine oil dipstick and there was an oil leak underneath the vehicle. The vehicle was taken to an independent mechanic who diagnosed that the engine oil cooler line crimp had detached. The vehicle was repaired. The local dealer and manufacturer were notified of the failure. The failure mileage was 42,000

Today March 25 2022 around 07:20 driving to work, the passenger side stationary panel of a 3 panel sliding window exploded with a loud noise. The window is totally shattered, but stayed in place. Little cubed glass is starting to fall from around the bottom edge.   A month ago, I had experienced a crackling arcing sound coming from the defrost on that same panel. I took it into Quirk Chevrolet, Manchester NH to have it looked at. they stopped the arcing and released the vehicle back to me and fixed under "service bulletin". I am finding many other individuals experiencing this same exploding glass issue. There is a bulletin out concerning this particular model and yr truck for sliding glass window defroster overheating issues. I am hearing that the dealer is not addressing this as an issue and not remedying this under warranty. I have only 28500 miles on the truck.

The ball joint for the front left tire broke while driving on a straight road and caused over $2,100 worth of damage to the wheel, axle, brake, etc. I had no warning or anything when this happened. It felt like my tire popped and when I pulled over, the wheel was still attached but was sitting at an awkward angle. The shop quoted me at $2,154 as there were 5 or 6 different parts they needed to repair including the ball joint, axle, brakes, brake sensors, rim, etc.
The screen for the backup camera is too bright causing the inability to use mirrors at night. I was told at the dealership that they could not touch it.

The contact owns a 2019 Chevrolet Silverado 1500. The contact stated that when her husband started the vehicle, the vehicle began to jerk and hesitate upon depression of the accelerator pedal. The check engine warning light illuminated. Due to the failure, the contact had the vehicle towed to a dealer where a diagnostic test was performed. The vehicle was diagnosed with a defective fuel pump module. The contact was also informed that the parts to repair the vehicle were unavailable. The manufacturer was then notified of the failure and after numerous calls, agreed to pay for her monthly vehicle payment while the vehicle remained at the dealer. The vehicle was not repaired. The failure mileage was approximately 50,000.

Dashboard and display screen doesn't shut off when key had been removed from the ignition. Constant freezing, call dropping and sound boost at random moments. Ticking sound when barely touching the gas. Hard shifts. Bluetooth connects and disconnects constantly. If GM released a defective vehicle, in which they are aware of the problems should be fixed. Not only for me but for the tons of thousands filing known major problems as well.

On multiple occasions while using an Apple phone that is connected to the vehicle via the USB port.   While on a phone call, the call will drop, and the radio will turn up to full volume and will not shut off until the entire vehicle is pulled over and completely powered off.  During the most recent event the radio did not shutoff even after vehicle was parked and powered down.  It eventually shut off after the autotimer shut down all of the accessories power after the timeout time.   The volume blast has happened twice in heavy metro Detroit, rush hour traffic.  The volume level is extraordinarily distracting & when on the expressway, its nearly impossible to find a safe or practical place to power down the vehicle to reset the radio.   The vehicle has been taken to the dealer to "flash" the radio, however it has not repaired the problem.

I bought the truck in Oct. of 2019 with 5000 miles on it. I have taken it to several service shops since then. I have told every one of those shops fro 2019 to present that there was something wrong with the truck. There has always been a hard clanking noise in the rear end. It always feels like it's in 4 wheel drive. It has never shifted right. When pulling a load it fells like it jumps in and out of gear. And when shifting from reverse to drive it clanks in the rear end. It feels like there is a brake dragging because when I let off the grass it will practically stop itself and it sound like a wheel cylinder is going out. Sometimes I have to push the start/stop engine button 2 to 3 times before the truck will shut off. The screen of the radio goes black sometimes. The rear tires don't turn when in 4 low. The tail gate doesn't lift like it's supposed to. The heater isn't right when you turn the defrost on it blows out at you feet. And when it remote started the heater doesn't always come on. All the reportes can be seen through the Chevrolet dealerships or OnStar. It has been taken to several different dealerships since 2019 when I bought it.

I have had several check engine codes on my truck. From what what the dealership tech put in his notes there is a bulletin on this. So, gm recognizes this is an issue.   The dealership had to replace several wires on my ECM wiring harness due to damage from rubbing against the harness bracket. I feel that gm should issue a recall to fix the rubbing on the harness and I feel gm should have to replace the whole harness not just the damaged wires.   I feel this is a hazard for these vehicles do to being on the internet state. I feel it will cause catastrophic injuries to the occupant as well as other drivers. It's hard to guess what that would cause the truck to do especially since everything is connected to the ECM.

The contact owns a 2019 Chevrolet Silverado 1500. The contact stated that the vehicle failed to start. The contact jumped the battery and was able to restart the vehicle. There were no warning lights illuminated. The contact stated that while reversing, the brake pedal was depressed but went all the way to the floorboard and hesitated to respond. The contact stated that the failure reoccurred three times. The contact stated that the third time the failure occurred, he jumpstarted the vehicle, and the vehicle restarted; however, the engine seized. The contact stated that the trailer brake warning light and several unknown warning lights illuminated. The contact turned off the vehicle and restarted the vehicle and was able to drive the vehicle at slow speeds. The contact charged the battery overnight and was able to start and drive the vehicle the next day. The contact also stated that the Parking brake was electronic and made it impossible to stop the vehicle in the event the battery failed. The dealer and the manufacturer were not notified of the failure. The vehicle was not diagnosed or repaired. The failure mileage was approximately 35,800.

1) Temperature outside 25 degrees F 2) Used Remote Start to warm up the truck 3) Truck ran for 5-8 mins 4) After getting in the truck when I closed the driver side door the full rear window glass completely shattered and blew out.  My understanding is that this was an issue in the past as per TSB 14815B   and seems to be a known issue that others have experienced as I saw when researching the safety issue on the internet.
Transmission shuttering and rpms surging under normal driving conditions. Shifting hard and shaking the vehicle at highway speeds.

Driving on state highway and truck felt like it went into neutral.  Pulled to side of road and put truck in park. Put truck in gear and nothing happened.  Truck would not move from side of the road.  Had truck towed to dealership and was told that the transmission was burnt out and had to be replaced. 2019 Chevy Trail Boss with 90k miles and the transmission fails. Unbelievable.

1st Time I was idling for 30+ minutes, truck was also making strange knocking noises, pulled on to a major highway and rear end locked up, cars were slamming on brakes, almost got killed. Took to shop left for 2 weeks, they said they could find no issues. I assumed they fixed problem, because there was no knocking any more. 3 weeks later, was idling for about 45minutes, pulled into traffic, dark, raining, rear en locked up. Almost got killed a second time. Took in for service and left truck. This needs to be investigated before someone gets killed!
The transmission don’t respond good

I HAVE HAD 2 TIMES THAT THE TRANSMISSION ON MY VEHICLE HAS BEEN REPAIRED OR REPLACED. THE TRANSMISSION IS NOW NOT OPERABLE.  MY TRUCK IS A 2019 CHEVROLET Silverado 1500 CREW CAB.  THIS IS THE THIRD TIME WITH THIS TRANSMISSION.  I NEED THIS PROBLEM INVESTIGATED.

Truck has excessive shuddering accelerating or decelerating. According to the service person at the dealer it is a problem with moisture and the factory fluid that the truck came with. Diagnostics showed excessive TCC Slippage which requires and upgraded transmission fluid. The TCM was also reprogrammed with the latest calibrations. Total cost $654.30.

VEHICLES REAR WHEELS LOCK UP AT 7 MPH. CONTINUALLY. HAD TO TOW TO DEALERSHIP. THEY REPLACED THE TCM AND THE TCCM. KNEW ONLY BECAUSE OTHER PEOPLE TOLD ME THIS IS A BIG PROBLEM WITH CHEVY'S. HAPPENED AT 36,090 MILES. WOULDN'T YOU KNOW. NOT COVERED UNDER ANY WARRANTIES.

6L80E 6 speed transmission. Vehicle slips at low speeds, under light acceleration. Sometimes when it shifts, its very hard and jerky. If this is normal designed operation, the transmission or programming needs to be redesigned.

Was Driving the truck when I got a Service Power steering and Service ESC and steering wheel turned hard had no steering assist while driving on the freeway was about to hit a curve when this happened had to stop completely since I couldn’t move the steering wheel! Took it to the dealer and they said it’s something they don’t cover so now they are trying to make me pay for something I have no clue about

Chirping sound coming left axle, also the transmission shifts hard and shutters down shifts hard up shifts when I put into drive it goes in hard at idle as of Monday November 22,2021 found puddle of transmission fluid on driveway, transmission is sealed can not check.told service tech about the transmission told me it was normal tired of dealing with service techs that lie to customers and that they know more than customers maybe some but not all some customer know more than they do, been building cars since I was 16, hot Rodder from way back.also have 2013 Buick LaCrosse 83,000 miles it has its 4th set of tires!!!? All my cameras go off and a blue screen comes up weather I’m parking or when I’m near another car. I can’t tell when Of there’s anything in front or behind me certain times and the parking alert comes up but cameras stay off.

Event in Order: -AutoStart, failure -Started with key -“Action Required” - “Steering Assist Is Reduced, Drive with Care” -“Service” - “Trailer Brake System” -“dash panel information” not available – Fuel Economy and oil life -“Traction Control light on” -Put truck in reverse, gear not engaged, no response -Put truck in drive, worked, but steering very difficult and made vehicle not safe to drive and/or operate.  This has happened to me once before but not to this extent, last was when I was driving and thankfully I was able to pull over and turn the vehicle off. It would not start after repeated attempts but finally started after and functioned normally. These events had not check engine lights and when serviced, the mechanics said they didn’t see anything when scanned. OnStar diagnostics had no report when I had it active. I bought this truck less than 18,000 miles ago. Initially bought at 17,181 miles on Feb 22, 2021 and is now at 34,675 miles as of Oct 29, 2021. This is a safety concern as the steering fail can potentially lead to an accident if the truck can’t be controlled. Traction control failure can lead to the vehicle becoming stalled in a dangerous situation. Brake systems can lead to unwanted breaking and/or being unable to break. This truck is a danger to operate.  I do have video but, upload does not support MP4 format.

Same issue I had with my 2017 Colorado. Shutter/shake when accelerating between 1 & 2. Issue started around 64k miles.  Thought maybe it needed the same transmission flush to the newer fluid. Dealer called after 4 days of holding my vehicle (with no loaner or rental option) to tell me that the trans needed an "update" and that it would cost me over $500 since I was over warranty at 67k. There's already a bulletin for the Camshaft Position Actuator Magnet Replacement, which supposedly memics the same issue. However the dealership says "that's not the problem". I'm sure the same trans issue with hard gear shifts is probably related to this issue now. I haven't felt the hard gear shift in a while but it would do it randomly when accelarating out of my driveway.

Service Trailer Brake System - warning code is displayed every time the vehicle is started and must be dismissed.  This does not allow for safe towing and braking.  Social media has displayed numerous other Chevy Trucks with this problem and have stated "cheap wire harness."  This needs to be replaced by the manufacture for using cheap materials.

ABS Brake Assist Module failed. Warning lights and indicators alerted the problem and the vehicle lost power assist braking. I was able to drive the vehicle to the local dealership as the warning message on the dash indicated the vehicle could not exceed 40 MPH with manual braking. Service tech diagnosed the module had failed, stated they are beginning to see this issue in more and more 2019 vehicles.

We bought the truck on 09-30-2021 with 24992 miles on it , brakes are all 4 horrible, no pads left and all 4 rotors are shot . This is a problem with this truck from the reports of this vehicle having premature brake wear from the Customer Satisfaction Program  . It is sitting at the repair shop as we speak with almost $1000 in brake repair that needs to be done . This is very unsafe . Please let me know what I need to do to be reimbursed . There has been prior recalls on this truck also for brakes

The contact owns a 2019 Chevrolet Silverado 1500. The contact stated while driving 10 MPH, the rear wheels inadvertently locked. There were no warning lights illuminated. The contact stated he veered to the side of the road, shifted into park, and turned off the vehicle. The contact was able to restart the vehicle but waited about four hours for the wheels to unlock. The vehicle was taken to the dealer who informed the contact that they were unable to diagnose the vehicle. The contact stated the failure had been reoccurring while driving. The contact became aware of an unknown customer satisfaction program for the failure. The vehicle was taken back to the dealer who informed the contact that he would be responsible for the cost of the repair because the vehicle was out of warranty. The manufacturer was made aware of the failure and referred the contact to the dealer for assistance. The vehicle was not diagnosed nor repaired. The approximate failure mileage was 12,000.

2Ø19 CHEVROLET SILVERADO 4WD LTZ CREW VIN [XXX]  Purchased: Royal Chevrolet (now Parks Chevrolet) 4502 West Broad Street Richmond, Virginia 23230 (804) 521-5300  In Service: 1 November 2019  Warranty Period: 1 November 2019 - 31 October 2022   Issues and History:  Issue I-- When starting vehicle, radio comes on at full volume for one to two seconds.  History I-- Prior to July 2021, never heard this noise. Beginning in mid-July 2021 with a mileage of approximately 3400 miles, the radio would blare full volume upon starting the vehicle. This occurred sporadically at first, but the event would happen more often as time went by.   The protocol used for shutting down the vehicle is as follows: a.Place gear shifter in Park. b.Engage electronic brakes. c.Completely turn off Climate system. dCompletely turn off Entertainment Console (Audio, et cetera). c.Turn off exterior lights. f.Turn off engine. g.Remove FOB with person. h.Exit vehicle and shut door(s). i.Engage locking and alarm systems twice with FOB.  The Settings for the Vehicle Sounds is zero volume and no button feedback.  Therefore, the radio should NOT activate except when engaged manually, and certainly not when the vehicle is starting and certainly not at full volume.  The vehicle was taken to Parks Chevrolet on Wednesday, 29 September 2021, where the Service Department retained the vehicle for two days trying to diagnosis this issue. We picked up the vehicle Thursday afternoon, 30 September 2021.   Friday morning, 1 October 2021, the vehicle was used, and upon starting, the radio blared at full volume for several seconds. The vehicle was not used Saturday. Sunday, 3 October 2021, the vehicle was used for a short trip to Eastern Henrico County's Osborne Landing. Although the radio did not blare when first starting the vehicle, it did blare for several seconds at the boat landing having sat for an hour.   The vehicle was used only three times during the week of 4 October through 10 October 2  INFORMATION Redacted PURSUANT TO THE FREEDOM OF INFORMATION ACT (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. 552(B)(6).

Truck lunges forward sometimes. It will work properly most of the time and then after stoping , when you tramp on the gas it will hesitate then lunge forward. As I said most of the time it works properly. I consider this a very real hazzard, has been doing this for months. One day at my golf club while pulling into my parking spot,a tight fit, I had to back up to get into my spot. When I tried to go forward it had  about a two second hesitation then squealed the tires. I have witnesses. My dealer says everything with the truck is normal after they inspected it . The internet is full of the same thing from other owners of the same truck.
Vehicle has 30,000 miles. Started the Vehicle in the morning and for no apparent reason the power steering was out. Error messages on the Dash were Service Power Steering and Service ESC

On September 11 at approx. 1630 hrs. my wife and I were going out for dinner.  I stopped at a stop light on a hill.  Transmission in Drive, foot on the brake.  Our truck suddenly started rolling backward.  I looked at the dash, no warning lights, gauges still working, transmission in drive, I stood on the brake pedal, no effect, I put the transmission in park, no effect, I engaged the parking brake, no effect other than the parking brake warning light came on.  We had rolled back approximately 50 feet.  I looked in my rearview mirror and observed a car approaching.  Luckily he/she saw my problem and stopped.   Things suddenly started coming back to life and came to a gentle stop.  When I looked in my mirror I was so close to the car behind me all I could see was his windshield, no hood.  I moved the transmission from park to drive and we continued on.      I have contacted the dealer and they are attempting to determine what happened.  However, I am afraid this will happen to someone else who may not be as lucky as I was or that it may happen to me again.  I pull a 5th wheel trailer with this truck.

The infotainment system on the 2019 Chevy Silverado fails when a passenger is using Carplay. While using Carplay for hands-free operation of a cellular device and or navigation the system will reboot continuously. Just prior to the system failures to begin the turn signals will begin to operate sporadically.  They will either stay on solid, off, or blink at an uneven interval. These system reboots create a safety issue as this forces the driver to take their eyes off of the road and physically disconnect and reconnect the cellular device.   By having to take my eyes off of the road to deal with the system rebooting this takes attention away and creates a safety issue for myself and all others on the road. One incident I had to slam on the brakes after looking back up and seeing that traffic had come to a sudden stop.  The unit has been replaced by the dealership one time thus far and the BCM computer has been replaced once as well. This has not resolved the issues. This is also not limited to my specific vehicle. There are hundreds of other owners reporting the same issues.  The problem was reproduced by one technician at the dealership but has not been reproduced by them since. (They all have Android devices minus the one tech. This is a Carplay issue.)  This has occurred more than 100 separate times on this vehicle beginning in November of 2019.

My truck has a vibration when going down the highway at speeds of 70 mph. The dealer has done a transmission flush but still have the same issue. I am afraid that the driveshaft or the transmission may lock up while we are on the highway with the family.

Started to drive my truck this morning and it was driving very rough. Dashboard warning lights came on; SERVICE PARKING BRAKE, SERVICE ESC, CHECK ENGINE LIGHT, STABILITY CONTROL LIGHT, PARKING BRAKE ON INDICATOR. None of this was happening yesterday. It just happened this morning. This truck only has 7,100 miles on it.

Thousands of these vehicles have Engine Lifter failure problems at early mileage and if your vehicle is out of warranty you have to pay. These are vehicles with the AFM 5.3 and many are failing. This is a well known problem and should be recalled soon. If your engine fails on the highway it can be extremely dangerous.
Clarity of the back up camera is very cloudy or not clear at all

The contact owns a 2019 Chevrolet Silverado 1500. The contact stated that the first day she drove the vehicle after it was delivered to her from Hawaii, the brake pedal was depressed and made abnormal ticking sounds. There were no warning lights illuminated. The vehicle was not diagnosed nor repaired by an independent mechanic or dealer. The contact stated that the failure recurred and the message "Check the Brake Pad" appeared on the instrument panel. The contact received notification of NHTSA Campaign Number: 19V814000 (Seat Belts), 19V888000 (Electrical System), 20V792000 (Seat Belts) and 19V889000 (Service Brakes, Hydraulic, Service Brakes, Electronic Stability Control) however, there were no dealers in American Samoa to perform the recall repairs. The dealer in Hawaii was made aware of the failure and referred the contact to the manufacturer. The manufacturer was made aware of the failure but provided no assistance. The vehicle was not repaired. The approximate failure mileage was 70.

Upon inspection, the tire had a 2–3-inch tear in the sidewall of the tire going from the center of the tire out words. There was nothing in the roadway and we did not hit anything. The sidewall just blew out of the tire. Tire size is 265/65/R18.

I tested it immediately and nothing changed.

The programing for the brakes was gone, they reprogrammed and it cleared out immediately.  They are working with GM to attempt to fix the issue once they figure it out.

Vehicle was parked and not running.  I got into the vehicle and started it.  I proceeded to put the vehicle in reverse and backed my truck up out of a parking spot.  I then put the vehicle in drive.  The vehicle started to go in reverse when I began to accelerate.  I then put the vehicle back in park and then back into drive.  The truck again started to go in reverse when in the drive position and I tried to accelerate and go forward.  At this point the truck's check engine light came on.  I put the truck in park, turned the vehicle off for a moment.  I then turned the truck back on and again shifted it to drive and the truck went forward.  We took the vehicle into the shop to have the codes run but a braking system code was the only thing that came up.  The dealership said they will begin looking into it and the vehicle will be serviced soon.  Safety Concern:  That if we were in a parking lot and placed our vehicle in drive and it actually goes in reverse, we could have harmed someone behind us or damaged someone's vehicle/home/etc.  I also worry there may be other issues that arise that could pose a safety concern since we don't really know what is going on.

We ended up cutting the seat belt to get him out.  The seat belt would not release after the vehicle was stopped and turned off.

I was given a 2019 Chevy Silverado and when I turned the truck off the shift to park light would stay on and in February the brakes froze with the bad freeze when it thawed the brakes just started locking up by them selves I could not get over 5-6 mph so I made an app with dealership took it in told them what it was doing they had it a week they replaced shifter handle and bolt and reset codes I get the truck back did not have it 24 hrs I was leaving where I was fishing that morning I was going maybe 40 mph when the abs and other lights came on on dash and the brakes locked up again sending me sliding about 60 yards when I ended up in a ditch I tried to get out and the truck would not move so I get out and look to see my front passenger tire completely broke off folding up under truck. No one else was involved I automatically called dealership told them what happen filed a crash report and tow truck took truck back to dealership I contacted GM snd they sent an investigator to look at it but denied my claim said it was not a Manufactur defect.. so no one is wanting to fix my truck now it’s still under warranty with less than 19000 miles on it... and if I was to pay out my pocket to fix it I feel that it will happen again cause the freeze did something to the electrical brake system.. the truck is a year and 4 mts old. Paid cash for it and not I can’t even drive it..
On cold starts when approximately 2nd gear shifts around 20mph the truck feels like it’s slipping the gear and losing power. Has happened every time and there’s under 5000 miles on vehicle

I purchased this vehicle back on February and noted that the transmission is kicking hard from first to second gear shift at all times. Went to the dealer and told me tech cannot find nothing wrong and that this is normal as is a 9 shift transmission. When at a fast food full line this vehicle shifted so hard that I almost hit the car on front on me. Having cars all my life and be a mechanic, I can tell you this hard shifting is a safety issue.

Brake sensor went off,lights stayed on inside cab,radio screen and lights inside went out,tailgate went down while being driven and tools etc were lost. Radio came on and changed channels non stop for almost an hour even after shutting vehicle off 4 timea. After 8 hrs it was back to normal.
Failed lifter in engine due to GM’s terrible DFM and DOD system. Left me stranded 500 miles from home and 450 miles from my destination.

The transmission will sometimes hesitate/lag for a few seconds when shifting from 1st gear to 2nd gear. This seems to occur only cold starts where the vehicle has sat for a long period, such as overnight.  On the most recent occurrence, I was stopped at a stop sign on my road and began to turn left (northbound) on to the busy highway. While turning from the stop sign on to the highway, the vehicle vehicle hesitated mid-shift and I lost acceleration. After a few seconds, a loud clunk was then heard, the truck jerked - throwing me forward, and acceleration was restored. This delay resulted in a near-miss collision as there was an approaching vehicle headed southbound and I was stuck in their lane since my vehicle was not accelerating.  Issue reported to Heartland Chevrolet (501 Rte 291, Liberty, MO 64068) to document and  investigate the issue. Vehicle taken to dealer next day. After 3 days of service, the dealer service team could not reproduce the issue and escalated to regional GM engineer (Service Manager called him directly.). Engineer stated that hesitation is normal.  Still an on-going issue; work around has been to let the vehicle idle longer before driving on a cold start. Sometimes you can "feel" the hesitation and know when to let off the gas pedal few a few seconds until the shift in to 2nd to avoid the vehicle throwing you forward, being able to have better "control" of the hesitation issue.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2019 CHEVROLET SILVERADO 1500. THE CONTACT STATED THAT AT START-UP AND OCCASIONALLY WHILE DRIVING AT VARIOUS SPEEDS, THE STEERING WHEEL CEASED TO OPERATE AS DESIGNED. I WAS DRIVING ON THE HIGHWAY FOR APPROXIMATELY 1 HOUR/75 MILES.  I PULLED OVER TO CLEAN OUT MY TRUCK.  I PARKED IN A VACANT PARKING LOT.  THE TRUCK'S ENGINE WAS RUNNING, THE VEHICLE WAS IN PARK.  IT WAS PARKED AT THE TOP OF A HILL. I GOT OUT OF THE DRIVERS COMPARTMENT, AND WALKED AROUND BEHIND TO THE PASSENGER'S SIDE, AND CLEANED OUT SOME TRASH. I THEN WALKED BACK AROUND TO THE REAR DRIVERS SIDE DOOR, AND REMOVED MORE TRASH. I WALKED ABOUT 15-25 FEET AWAY, TO PUT THE TRASH IN THE GARBAGE CAN.   THE TRUCK MADE A WEIRD 'CHIRP-CHIRP-CHIRP' ALARM/ELECTRICAL TYPE NOISE, AND THEN DROVE BACKWARDS. THE REVERSE LIGHTS WERE ON.  I RAN AFTER THE TRUCK, THE DRIVERS DOOR WAS LOCKED. I PUSHED THE UNLOCK BUTTON ON THE DOOR AND HOPPED UP ON THE RUNNING BOARD. I OPENED THE DRIVERS DOOR AND JUMPED IN, AND SLAMMED ON THE BRAKES.  I STOPPED THE TRUCK, LITERALLY ONE FOOT FROM GOING OVER AN 8 FOOT CONCRETE EMBANKMENT.    I AM REALLY TERRIFIED BY WHAT HAPPENED.   IT WAS IN PARK.  IT HAS THAT NEW SYSTEM WHERE THE KEYS STAY IN YOUR POCKET AND EVERYTHING IS PUSH BUTTON (START, UNLOCK)   THE VEHICLE'S COLUMN SHIFTER WAS STILL IN PARK WHEN I STOPPED THE TRUCK.    PHOTOS:  1.) THIS IS THE HILL, AND SPACE I WAS PARKED IN.  2.) THESE ARE MY TIRE TRACKS, MY TRUCKS TIRES HIT THAT SHEET METAL, AND YOU CAN SEE THE APPROXIMATE 8 FOOT DROP WITH THE DUMPSTERS.  3.) THIS SHOWS THE CONCRETE SPEED BUMP THING THAT MY TRUCK BACKED OVER WHEN IT WAS ROLLING OUT OF CONTROL     THIS SHOULD NOT HAVE BEEN MECHANICALLY POSSIBLE.  IF IT WAS IN PARK IT CAN'T HAPPEN (THEORETICALLY)  IF IT WAS IN REVERSE, IT WOULD HAVE BACKED UP IMMEDIATELY AFTER LETTING MY FOOT OFF THE BRAKE.  IF IT HAD BEEN IN NEUTRAL, IT WOULD HAVE DRIFTED BACKWARDS IMMEDIATELY DUE TO THE GRADE OF THE HILL.  IF IT HAD BEEN IN DRIVE OR LOW, IT WOULD HAVE MOVED FORWARD, OR STAYED STILL.
